intro: Coelospermum morindiforme, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Coelospermum morindiforme is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
